content:
Diagnosis:
Malignant pleural mesothelioma with chest wall invasion

Staging:
cT4N2M0 with extensive chest wall involvement and mediastinal lymphadenopathy
PD-L1 TPS 5%

Previous medical history:
Asbestos exposure 1970-1995
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension

Current medications:
Morphine sulphate MR 30mg BD
Paracetamol 1g QDS
Metformin 1g BD

Current situation:
Progressive disease with worsening chest pain and breathlessness
Requiring increased analgesia
Performance status 2

MDT Discussion 15 April 2024:
Case presented with recent CT showing enlarging right pleural mass now 8.2 x 6.5cm (previously 6.8 x 5.1cm) with new chest wall invasion at 4th-6th ribs. Progressive mediastinal lymphadenopathy with largest node 2.8cm. No distant metastases.

MDT recommendations:
1. Not suitable for surgery due to T4 disease
2. For first line systemic therapy with Carboplatin/Pemetrexed
3. Consider palliative radiotherapy to chest wall after cycle 2 if pain persists
4. Early palliative care referal advised

Plan:
To commence chemotherapy next week
Urgent palliative care review arranged
Repeat CT after 3 cycles
Follow up in 3 weeks with Dr [redacted name]
